H0.text: Mechanical isolation is the cause of speciation between these two garter snakes, which originated from a single ancestor and occupy the same geographic area, yet one lives in arid land and the other lives in water.

H1.text: Behavioral isolation is the cause of speciation between two garter snake species in the genusâ€¯Thamnophis that originated from a single ancestor, occupy the same geographic area, with one living in arid land and the other in water.

H2.text: Habitat isolation is the cause of speciation between the two garter snake species in the genus *Thamnophis*, which originated from a single ancestor and now occupy the same geographic area, with one species living in arid land and the other living in water.

H3.text: Allopatric isolation is the cause of speciation between the two garter snake species of genus *Thamnophis* that originated from a single ancestor and now occupy the same geographic area, with one inhabiting arid land and the other inhabiting water.

A4.text: Habitat differences may be more important in the development of reproductive isolation than the isolation time.

A5.text: Parapatric speciation may be associated with differential landscape-dependent selection.
